intro: Dyssodia friasensis, commonly known as the Friasensis Dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually hairy and serrated, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Dyssodia friasensis is often found in rocky soils and is a component of local flora in its native habitat.
